intro: Corydalis crystallina var. strictissima, commonly known as the strict Corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained, moist soil and prefers partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to the landscape.
